  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41718].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Confluence JIRA issues macro does not display linked issues as strikethrough when they are resolved, while the JIRA issues navigator does. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Display linked issues as strikethrough when they show as strikethrough in JIRA. Please see the screenshots attached to this ticket. The Confluence view would look just like the JIRA view does.
fields.summary: Display linked issues column as strikethrough in the JIRA issues macro if they have a resolution in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41712].
  {panel}

In Confluence, we can use the [Keyboard Shortcuts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Keyboard+Shortcuts] in order to work with the editor and other feature of the Application. However, when we use the [Confluence Preview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Display+Files+and+Images#DisplayFilesandImages-Previewafile] to take a look at attachments and images, we can only use the keyboard to move to the next/previous attachment and close the Previews. 

Having keyboard shortcuts for all of the commands available within the preview plugin would definitely help. Having said that, it would be important that the keyboard shortcuts are listed on-screen (for both sighted users as well as users using screen readers). Additionally, for any controls in the preview pane, it would be good to allow the user to tab through those controls as that is a fairly well used mechanic utilized with screen readers.

This is a suggestion to allow the users to also have keyboard shortcuts to access the other options of the Preview. For example:

# 'D' to Download the image file.
# 'U' Upload a new version of the file (attached files only).
# 'C' to Comment on the file.
# 'Z' for the Zoom, out or fit the image to the width of your browser.
# 'B' to Browse like a slideshow using the next and back buttons.
# 'S' Switch to a full screen presentation mode
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut for Confluence Previews

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41697].
  {panel}

h4.Symptoms

While using the Confluence editor, one of the options that we have is to [insert tables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Working+with+Tables]. When using such content, if you try to manually add whitespaces in the table, it will be ignored depending on how you insert it. 

For example, in the following table, while editing Confluence, we can see the whitespaces before the numbers, in the first column: 

!table.png!

If you *save* the page, the whitespaces will be ignored. 

h4.Workaround

Type the number of whitespaces needed in another part of the page and then, manually *copy* and *paste* it inside the table. By doing it, Confluence will identify the pasted content as a character and it will not ignore, having it looking like the screenshot used above:

# Go to any page that you would like to have the whitespaces in the tables
# In a blank part of this page, type the number of spaces that you need to the table
# Copy the blank spaces used in a random part of the page
# Paste inside the table, in the location that you need.
# Save the page
fields.summary: Whitespaces Ignored for Tables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41687].
  {panel}

Hi Dear support,



I use the following to display the svg attachment in my confluence page. somehow if the svg file name contains "%", the thumbnails can not be displayed.
eg. using 
[!pic_50%_load_cpu.svg|width=600!|^pic_50%_load_cpu.svg]
the thumbnails can not be displayed in the page, but it can be displayed if you click this pic link. it will be opened in another browser window. the pic link will became "*pic_50%{color:red}25{color}_load_cpu.svg"

but if just uploading same picture without "%" in the file name. it will be displayed well.
eg
[!pic_half_load_cpu.svg|width=600!|^pic_half_load_cpu.svg]

Confluence version: 2.10.3.
fields.summary: failed to deplay svg in Thumbnails if the svg file name including "%"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41685].
  {panel}

We're using Confluence Cloud as well as Box as a cloud-based enterprise. An important use case is to embed Box widgets in Confluence pages.

The Widget Connector Macro should support Box embeds. Box has an API to obtain the embed URL, so this seems pretty simple to implement. Here's some documentation from Box for developers.

It seems the same issue was closed in 2014 as unresolved. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23203

Since Widget Connector doesn't work, we're using a painful manual workaround with Iframe Macro. The user has to manually set up the iframe, which is confusing for laymen. Basically, they need to find and copy the embed link and then paste it in an iframe macro, and at minimum define the width and height. Box instructions for embed widget.

Also, the Iframe Macro doesn't seem to support full screen. It should have a field or checkbox for "allowfullscreen". 

Please support Box.com with the Widget Connector! It is crucial for the workflow of any company using Box.com for file storage.
fields.summary: Widget connector support for Box.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41683].
  {panel}

Today is the first day I tried to post questions about Atlassian Confluence.  I apparently don't have 3 karma points yet, so my activities are limited.

I posted a question.  Someone posted an answer to it.  I tried to write a comment on that answer, but it seemed to hang trying to display the comment box, so I created a new question to ask the question I was trying to ask in the comment.  I later noticed that the comment box finally displayed, so I went back to it and added the information about the question I wanted to ask.  When I tried to post it, it said I couldn't do that until I had 3 karma points.

I then went to the second question I had posted.  Someone provided an answer to that, but I had to ask an additional question, so i tried to write a comment asking that question.  Guess what it said?  I then tried to post a new third question, and it just said "Not Permitted".

Do I have to go somewhere else to get questions answered about how to use Atlassian products?
fields.summary: Restricting my actions until I get 3 points shouldn't apply to writing comments to answers to my own question

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41682].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When listing attachments on a page in Confluence, there's an option to Download All attachments.

If a page has a particularly large number of attachments, this can cause Confluence to crash.

 !Screen Shot 2016-05-12 at 16.27.02.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability for administrators to disable the download option either for an entire instance, or some pages.
 
h3. Workaround 
In Server it is possible to [disable via code|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+disable+attachment+downloads] but this is not an option in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to disable Download All feature from attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41640].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Java 8 update 20 has introduced an additional flag for the G1 garbage collector that enables string deduplication to lower the memory footprint of the JVM. The functionality can be enabled by adding the {{-XX:+UseStringDeduplication}} JVM flag.

More information about this parameter can be found in the following links:
- [https://blogs.oracle.com/java-platform-group/entry/g1_from_garbage_collector_to]
- [http://java-performance.info/java-string-deduplication/]
- [https://blog.codecentric.de/en/2014/08/string-deduplication-new-feature-java-8-update-20-2/]

h4. Suggestion
Evaluate adding this parameter by default, as it is said not to cause significant performance overhead, however it can save additional heap memory, asynchronously to GC cycles.
fields.summary: Enable string deduplication by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41625].
  {panel}

Within a given project the colors of a pie chart change their meaning, particularly if a pie chart reports out status based information. I have a status board showing pie charts of various aspects of a broad effort. Filtering on the total effort, or one of the two aspects results in three separate pie charts where the colors map to different statuses! This makes the pages significantly less easy to interpret. 

The current implementation appears to assign colors based upon the magnitude of various aspects of the project, which might be fine for filtering on other things, but on status it makes multiple pie charts on the same page difficult. A fix for this would be to assign colors based upon the order the statuses are enumerated... in such a way the statuses wouldn't change from one chart to the next, and you could again interpret the charts as "too much blue" or "all green means everything is closed", etc.

Some examples follow.

*Total work effort:*
!image-2016-05-06-08-02-18-756.png|thumbnail! 

*One of the two aspects:*
 !image-2016-05-06-08-03-24-197.png|thumbnail! 

*The other aspect:*
 !image-2016-05-06-08-03-48-096.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Chart (Pie Chart) Colors Change Meaning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41622].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Many attachment-*.tmp files remain in <confluence_install>/temp after uploading attachment files to a Page with REST API.
 
Thousands of attachment-*.tmp files remain in <confluence_install>/temp directory.
Somethimes amount of total file sizes become several GB.
those files are not deleted by scheduled job, since the job deletes files in <confluence_home>/temp.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.9


h3. Steps to Reproduce

 1. curl -v -S -u admin:password -X POST -H "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -F "file=@myfile.txt" -F "comment=this is my file" "http://localhost:8090/rest/api/content/<page id>/child/attachment" | python -mjson.tool
 2. check <confluence_install>/temp directory.

h3. Expected Results

Templory files should be deleted after completing the REST API.
or 
A scheduled jos deletes them.

h3. Actual Results
Templory files remain after competing REST API program.
And when Confluence is stopped, those tmp files are deleted.
This means those files maybe remain in temp directory for long term.


h3.Workaround
 restart conflunece, then those attachment-*.tmp files are deleted.
fields.summary: Clean up attachment-*.tmp files in <confluence_install>/temp directory.
The change of the headline of a page not reflected in the page history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41619].
  {panel}

The Image Gallery macro provides various parameters for including/excluding images based on image name and labels. Display of the images does honour these parameters, except when clicking on the images and scrolling through. Then other attachments to the page are also displayed.

E.g. A page with attachments application.png, desktop.png, paddock.png, meadow.png & processes.pdf. Files paddock.png & meadow.png have label 'gallery'. Using various combinations of parameters *Images to Exclude*, *Include these Images Only*, *Exclude Images with these Labels* & *Include Images with these Labels Only* will display the correct images on the page.
However if one of the images is clicked the images are displayed in the attachment preview, and the user can then scroll through *ALL* attachments to the page.

It would be better if the images displayed are limited to those specified in the Image Gallery macro.
fields.summary: Image Gallery Macro should includeexclude images when viewing in preview

Hi there,

just a simple request: Please let us show more tasks via task report macro. Current values are 10, 20, 40 and are way to low.

There is great potential (!) in analysing tasks via task report plus table filter macro, but this doesn't work, as long you are not able to show all tasks on one page.

(maybe add a hint, that showing more than 500 tasks or someting can reduce performance).

Regards

Raphael

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41561].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
After adding context path, some of the image icons will break because they are still pointing to the old URL

h3. Steps to Replicate 
# Download and install [Confluence O6.0.0-OD-2016.12.4-1123|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-od/]
# [Configure a Context path|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-change-the-confluence-context-path-707985922.html] {{/confluence}}  for the Confluence
# Go to {{Space Tools >> Permission}}

h3. Expected Result
All the icons are displayed correctly
!step1.png|thumbnail!

h3.Actual Result
All the icons are missing
 !wrong context.png|thumbnail! 

If we inspect the icon, the context path is missing from the URL :
* ICON URL that does not have context path - {{<HOSTNAME>/s/en_GB/6437/b27ad99d003a624e726f95c32335af2b8b3b5548/_/images/icons/emoticons/check.png}}. This does not work
* ICON URL that have context path - {{<HOSTNAME>/confluence/s/en_GB/6437/b27ad99d003a624e726f95c32335af2b8b3b5548/_/images/icons/emoticons/check.png}}. This URL works
fields.summary: Confluence icons breaks after Context Path is added

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41560].
  {panel}

A note for your team - I recently voted for CONF-34211, which appears to be a long-standing issue.  I am going to try the workaround recommended in the bug, but would love to see the 'Export to Word' function working seamlessly - OR - remove the menu choice.

We moved to Scroll PDF exporter, and that plug-in has been helpful for PDF. Perhaps this feature should require a configurable plug-in as well?

If you want to contact me to discuss further, I would be open to that.

Steve Abel
steve.abel@twcable.com
Senior Technical Writer (and on our team of Atlassian Administrators)
Time Warner Cable
fields.summary: Export to Word Feature not exporting images
Ability to customize Confluence blank page to add a WARN message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41557].
  {panel}

h5. Suggestion

Optionally use Bitbucket and/or Bitbucket Server to store attachments for Confluence. This would be especially beneficial for large files, with Git LFS that was recently introduced.

Through branch permissions and application links, permissions could be managed as well and many of the problems that currently exist in attachment handling in Confluence would be solved by this.

File versioning would also be solved by the basic concepts of SCM.
h5. Possible implementation

There could be a Bitbucket project per Confluence instance, creating a repository for each space. Branch permissions could be used to maintain permissions outside of Confluence as well, but alternatively the project/repository could be limited to the integration only.
fields.summary: Use Bitbucket server for optional attachment storage

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41551].
  {panel}

*The problem:* If you request the content body using the content rest API, and the content contains macros, the macros don't work (in most cases).

*The cause:*
1 - Some macros don't explicitly list their web resource dependencies, and so the web resource is not included in the response from the API.
2 - Web resources that are included in the superbatch are excluded from API response, so if the super batch doesn't exist on the page, then javascript errors are thrown due to missing dependencies.
3 - Some macros assume a page load lifecycle that will have a load/ready event. When using the rest API this is often not the case.
fields.summary: Cannot render macros from content rest API

fields.description:
h1. *Problem definition*

Currently there are two steps on the Confluence on-boarding experience for new users – (1) *Who's on your team?*: to invite other people to collaborate together and then (2) *Choose a space to work in*: to chose which space you want to watch or create a new space.
||Step 1||Step 2||
|!image-2019-06-26-12-58-18-284.png!|!image-2019-06-26-12-58-35-761.png!|

The features are very helpful for starting teams, but they also cause the following problems.
h2. *Step 1*
 # If a new person in the company joins Confluence, they won't really have additional people to add to collaborate with them, they might try to invite their buddy, causing the next problem.
 # The invited users will become access requests for the site administrators, already existing users will also show up there, confusing the administrators as to know what happens if they deny or accept it, there is no way to ignore the request. Scenario probably tied to ID-6682.

h2. *Step 2*
 # When you are starting a Confluence site, there are no spaces, so it makes sense to start by creating one, but for new users, they are prompted to create a space if they do not have access to see other spaces, now for a new user that just arrived, the likelihood of having a dummy space created is big.
 # New users without the create space permission will still be prompted to create a space, they will type a name and click next, landing on the Confluence dashboard and without any spaces or any message of clarification.
 # The screen is not large enough or does not provide an option to see the full space name when the length is larger than the available space, additionally, there is no description of what the space is about.
 # New users do not have instructions on what to do at this point of their on-boarding, which space to watch, etc, they might end up watching a random space and getting spammed by unuseful content on their email box.

h1. *Notes*

Per this article on [how to skip the wlecome action in confluence for new users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-skip-the-welcome-action-in-confluence-for-new-users-777016501.html], Confluence Server administrators can disable the add-on that manages the Welcome page for new users in Confluence. The page will be displayed to users until the new users watch a space.

However, in Confluence Cloud disabling system add-ons is a restricted function, and thus administrators in Cloud cannot skip the welcome screen.
h1. *Suggestion*

Make the Confluence on-boarding experience configurable.
h2. *Step 1*
 * Allow administrators to disable this step or only show the screen for newly created Confluence sites, while the team is growing.

h2. *Step 2*
 * Provide the option to customize a welcome message for new users.
 * Allow administrators to set a default watch space for new users, additionally offering the option to disable the step in the case a default space is selected.
 * Show the description of the selected space if available.
 * Provide the option to disable the step.
fields.summary: Improve the configurability of the Confluence on-boarding experience for new users
Link on Confluence Documentation is Obsolete
Add .xtlm files to the supported files for Office Excel Macro
Option to disable space export
Comments not saving in gallery macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41537].
  {panel}

Hi team,

Need your help in resolving the following bug asap. Any help would be much appreciated.

*Issue:* I have a couple of epics and some stories associated with each of them in JIRA. When I created a wiki page in Confluence, I inserted some issues from JIRA using "JIRA Issue/Filter" built-in macro to display all the Epics and their respective stories in a table. 
While all the other attributes appear correctly +I am not able to get to display, the names of the Epics in the table+. I have included +Epic Name+ and +Epic Link+ both the columns, but Epic Name column in the table is empty, while Epic Link just populates the JIRA Id of the Epic in question.

*Ultimately, I need to display Epic Names in the table and not their ids.* Please suggest how this could be fixed.

+*Also, for your reference, please find the screen shot attached with the ticket*+

h3.Update

This issue seems to also affect other fields like Version. When user generates a report; instead of showing the version number; it shows the version ID instead.

For example. 

{code}
jira=> select * from projectversion where id = 17718;
  id   | project | vname | description | sequence | released | archived | url | releasedate | startdate 
-------+---------+-------+-------------+----------+----------+----------+-----+-------------+-----------
 17718 |   11200 | 1.9   |             |       10 |          |          |     |             | 
(1 row)
{code}

When a report is generated; instead of showing version 1.9 for an issue in a report; it shows 17718 instead.
fields.summary: Epic Names and Version using JIRA Issue/Filter macro (in Confluence), cannot be displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41533].
  {panel}

Hi,

the styling of Sign-Up button in invitation mails can be rendered correctly by Lotus Notes (in our case 9.0.1). The blue part is not rendered and due to the font colour being white, it's not visible in the email.

You can generate this problem by either sending an invitation to an Lotus Notes user or a password reset request.

I understand, that Lotus Notes is not officially supported by Atlassian, however as a administrator, I do not necessarily have the control over my clients email applications, i.e. I do not know what they use or it's not my decision. Basically, if I send out invitations, I do not know if the email is readable or not.

One easy solution to this could be to just send an link without any style applied. Could be implemented as an option for customers who face this problem.
fields.summary: Customize invitation Email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41532].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When exporting a page as PDF, the content of attachments using the {{view-file}} macro (e.g.PDF, PowerPoint) are not rendered. Also, attachments are not included in the PDF export, not in the place they were inserted, nor at the end as an appendix.

This is the page in Confluence
!ConfluencePage_CONF_41532.png|thumbnail!

This is the exported PDF page. Note the attachment is displayed with the paperclip attachment image.
 [^TIC-CONF-41532-300816-1108-2.pdf] 

h3. Suggested Solution
Attachments are rendered inline with the option of including them at the end as a print out.

h3. Workaround
There is no work around.
fields.summary: Include Attachments when exporting a page to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41529].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
[Enabling absolute date/time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-relative-dates-in-jira-applications-414187622.html] in JIRA does not display absolute date/time for issues in a JIRA issue macro. The JIRA issue macro seems to use the syntax of the {{Date Format}} field, rather than the {{Date Time Format}} field, in Formatting and International Settings. 

This would be particularly useful when tracking sprints in Confluence. Attached are two screenshots showing the difference between the date/time display in JIRA and Confluence (in the JIRA issue macro).

h3. Also applies to:
Filter Results macro in Confluence 
Filter Results gadget in JIRA

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to enable absolute date/time in Confluence. 
 

h3. Workaround
Set the {{Date Format}} in *Confluence Administration > General Configuration > Formatting and International Settings* to include time (matching the {{Date Time Format}}): 
{{MMM dd, yyyy HH:mm}}
fields.summary: Absolute date/time not available in JIRA issue macro

After having moved quite a lot of items, I found out I couldn't open the attachments that where attached to the moved items! Among them are images, text files and spreadsheets.

We are using this version:

 !image-2016-04-26-10-09-25-631.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41519].
  {panel}

We noticed today that a link, where the https:// was mistyped and was missing the final slash, got redirected as if it were a directory on the local web server, instead of just being a broken link.  Would it be better to leave it broken, or to repair the link, instead of prefixing the local server to it?

Steps to reproduce:
1. Edit this page:  https://wiki.cac.washington.edu/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=72219641
2. Insert a mistyped link:  http:/washington.edu/calendar/trumba
3. Click Save
4. Go visit your link and see where it goes.

Expected:
1. Link would be "fixed" and extra / would be added after the http:/ so the link would go to its intended destination
or
2. Link would go to broken link that I typed in
or
3. I would have been notified after step 2 (or possibly after step 3) that I entered an invalid link

Actual:
https://wiki.cac.washington.edu/ is affixed to the beginning of my link making it:
https://wiki.cac.washington.edu/https:/washington.edu/calendar/trumba
I can understand why the software thought that the "https:/" could have been a directory, but this has been confusing for some of our users.
fields.summary: https:/ is not treated as link prefix

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41518].
  {panel}

I often write processes into confluence. Over time these instructions get replaced. Mostly I just delete the old document when this happens, but sometimes we need to keep two versions alive for a period of time. 

I currently notify users of this scenario using a 'warning' macro.

What I would like is a macro that floats a notification directing the user to the new instructions. I'd like this to stick to the top of the page so it is visible no matter how far down the reader scrolls.

I can do this on a self hosted instance using a user macro and CSS, but I can't do this in the Cloud instance of Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to have a page specific notification panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41515].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-site-152034.html
The above page says that 'Confluence supports importing site and space backups into the same *major* version only' but goes on to describe *minor* version numbers.
Can we please get confirmation for which one is correct?
Are only Minor version numbers supported and 'major' is a typo?
fields.summary: Fix documentation around xml site restoration supported versions
Test vom Mila

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41512].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a User is making page edits across multiple different pages in an instance, they must uncheck 'Notify Watchers' on each page prior to saving/publishing so that they do not notify watchers of changes made.

h3. Suggested Solution
Keep the setting for 'Notify Watchers' across multiple page edits.
 
h3. Workaround 
Uncheck "Notify Watchers" on different page Page Edits before Saving/Publishing changes.
fields.summary: Disable Notify Watchers on Subsequent Page Edits After Being Unchecked on Another Page
X-Accel-Redirect scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41502].
  {panel}

I want to add my voice to the many others who have expressed a desire to have more fine-grained control over notifications on a per-space (and perhaps per-page too).  This is to support the situation when a private space is set up to contain sensitive information (passwords, private keys, etc.) and we don't want page edits to trigger email containing the sensitive information (as that will open up many more ways in which that info can be sniffed or hacked by 3rd parties).

The ideal solution will implement the same Notification Scheme setup available in JIRA (where each JIRA project can be assigned its own notification scheme... similar, each Confluence space should have the ability to be assigned its own notification scheme also.

Many others have asked for this before:
CONF-174
CONF-29996
CONF-27567
CONF-28326
CONF-30826
CONF-33698
CONF-35985
CONF-41394
CONF-33887

I think this is a basic/fundamental functionality for a wiki software designed to support multiple spaces with different access rights.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Disable notifications per-space (and perhaps per-page too)

h3. Problem Definition
End users sometimes need to have the ability to evaluate whether the permissions set on a page/space are correct. Without administrator permissions, end users cannot view all permissions and won't be able to view them for restricted spaces/pages.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a page displaying the permissions of the page/space. User doesn't need to have ability to modify it though.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41463].
  {panel}

Hello,
We can customize colors only in charts macro so far. And still it lacks one feature that is to link a color to a specific serie.
When using several charts on the same page with the same set of series, charts that have one of the series that has no data induce a color shift in the chart.
So latests series in the charts are rendered with different colors.
It would be nice to have not only a color list as parameter for custom colors in charts, but a list of key/value so we can specify the color of each serie specifically.
This option should be propagated to "jira chart" macro.

Here is a sample with jira chart and another with usual chart (using an automatically generated table for the data set)
fields.summary: customize colors of charts and jira charts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41462].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If your Page Properties Macro contains pagination, the pagination will not load when inside the macro body of Page Properities contains JIRA Issue Macro value. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Page Properities Macro Report to a page (set the number of items to display to 2)
# Add Page Properties Macro to two pages (without JIRA Issue Macro to the Value)
!Step 2.png|thumbnail! 
# Add Page Properties Macro to one page (add JIRA Issue Macro to the Value)
 !Step 3.png|thumbnail! 
# Reload the page containing the Page Properties Report Macro 
# Use the Pagination to navigate to 2
# Then back to 1 

h3. Expected Results
* Page Properties Report Macro pagination should load the table when a Page Properties includes JIRA Issue Macro value
!Expected Behaviour.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Page Properties Report Macro pagination breaks when a Page Properties includes JIRA Issue Macro value
!Actual Behaviour.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Reload the page containing the Page Properties Report Macro and the table will reload.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro pagination breaks when a Page Properties includes JIRA Issue Macro value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41461].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you add a new file to a page with the same file name to the page. Existing files will be kept with the same name and the new file will be added as a new version.

h3. Suggested Solution
In a case where a user uploads a new file with the same file name to the page, it should provide a conflict error and options to add a new file or add a new version.
fields.summary: Provide conflict error when uploading new file with the same file name to the page

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41433].
  {panel}

Confluence PDF File viewer cannot preview attached PDF-1.7 format.

h4. Actual behavior:

# Attach PDF-1.7 file in Confluence page. (e.g PDF file saved from outlook mail)
# Preview the PDF file in Confluence will display the following:

{code} For the best experience, open this PDF portfolio in Acrobat X or Adobe reader X, or later {code}

h4. Expected behavior:

Confluence will preview the PDF file properly.


h4. Workaround

# Open the PDF-1.7 file using acrobat reader
# Save as new copy - Confluence will save the file as PDF-1.6 format or lower
# Attach to Confluence
# Confluence can preview the file.
fields.summary: Cannot preview PDF-1.7 format in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41432].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if you attempt to add an inline comment to a block of text that contains a link, you will receive an error: "We can't add an inline comment to this content. We'll add it as a page comment instead."

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow inline commenting for text that contains links. 
 
h3. Workaround 

Highlight only the non-linked words.
fields.summary: Allow inline commenting on link + non-link text
